alert.note: Alert for Northern Tangipahoa; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 4:49PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Tangipahoa and west central Washington Parishes through 530 PM CDT... At 449 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wilmer, or 10 miles northeast of Amite, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and brief funnel clouds. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmer. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
